Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 16 May 2019First of all, set aside a portion that you would seem as emergency funds. I am also assuming that you have no other big ticket items coming up, since that is a significant expense.With the remaining funds, I would then look to invest in it. You could do it the hands-on way with robo-advisors, or try your own hand at equity investments, which also require a relatively lower capital size.Later on when you have amassed a larger sum, you might want to look at other things such as property etc.0 comments0
